title: Effect of Mn substitution on Parasitic Reactions at the Interface of MgCr2-xMnxO4 Cathodes for Rechargeable Magnesium-Ion Battery
content: Rechargeable Magnesium Batteries (RMBs) are one of the most important energy storage devices for the current era of technological development. The potential broad implementation of this emerging battery technology is intricately linked to the discovery of cathode materials with high storage capacity.[1-2] Spinel-based metal oxides such as MgM2O4 (where M represents Cr, Mn, Fe, V, Co), enable the insertion of Mg2+ ions at elevated potentials (2–3 V vs. Mg/Mg2+) and double the theoretical capacities (∼220 to 280 mA h g−1) [1].
